column1: Mediastinoscopy with biopsy is a procedure in which a lighted instrument (mediastinoscope) is inserted in the space in the chest between the lungs (mediastinum).
A small surgical cut is made in the neck.
- This procedure is also done for certain infections (tuberculosis, sarcoidosis) and autoimmune disorders.
Biopsies of lymph node tissues are normal and do not show signs of cancer or infection.
Abnormal findings may indicate: - Hodgkin disease - Lung cancer - Lymphoma - Sarcoidosis - The spread of disease from one body part to another - Tuberculosis
